metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000379 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The Linux Kernel running on AMD64 systems will sometimes map the contents of PIE executable, the heap or ld.so to where the stack is mapped allowing attackers to more easily manipulate the stack. Linux Kernel version 4.11.5 is affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000379` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-121-generic - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-lowlatency - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-3.13.0-121-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-121.170
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-121-generic - 3.13.0-121.170
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1

notes.Note: sbeattie> it's unclear which of the stack clash patches addressed this issue, but it does seem to have been addressed in that patch set.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-121.170').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
